newsitem.title: USA: Baron group lifts Saga Communications stake.
newsitem.headline: Baron group lifts Saga Communications stake.

text.p: A group led by New York investor Ronald Baron said on Tuesday it had raised its stake in Saga Communications Inc to 2,586,149 class A common shares or 36.5 percent of outstanding class A shares.

In a filing with the Securities and Exchange Commission, the group said it had bought 84,700 additional Saga shares between October 3 and December 2 at prices ranging from $19.625 to $22.6818 a share.
The group previously held 2,501,449 class A common shares, representing a 31.1 percent stake in Saga, a Grosse Point, Michigan-based radio and television broadcast company.
